results.title: Crab fisherman
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the harmony of nature and man in a poignant work about man and the sea. Shows the dignity of men at work on a hard dangerous job as ancient as ships of wood.

results.title: CPR for citizens
results.brief_description: Basic techniques for emergency care of heart attack and choking victims, which allows the person at the scene of the attack to keep the heart pumping and the brain alive until help arrives. Identifies the principles of cardio-pulmonary resuscitation and explains its importance. Uses a mannequin and simple clear explanations for demonstrations. Commentary by Orson Welles.

results.title: Cowes Regatta
results.brief_description: Hundreds of craft assemble in the harbour at Cowes, to participate in the world famous regatta. From Cowes the film takes you to the Brittania Cup race, 1965, with the Duke of Edinburgh and Princess Anne competing in the royal yacht, Bloodhound.

results.title: Cowboy
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Michael Ahnemann and Gary Schlosser
results.brief_description: The day-to-day existence of the working cowboy. It examines the life on a Californian ranch of a contemporary “cowpuncher”, Bill Bailey, and his family. Narrated by themselves, it reveals the hard work and simple pleasures and the profound rewards. Living in the open and close to the land, the cowboy retains the individuality and self-reliance which marked his forbears. Photographed at the Rex Ellsworth Ranch Tehachapi California.

results.title: Cow on the frontier = Krava na granici
results.brief_description: An animated film showing a harmless cow grazing a field, which unwittingly steps across the frontier that separates one country from another. A satire on war.

results.title: Cover to cover looks at ... = a pet for Mrs Arbuckle ...
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production, Anna Grieve, John Marsh and Don Fitzsimmons
results.brief_description: Three programs from the Cover to cover series which look at three of Australia’s best known children’s books. The authors and illustrators talk about how their books evolved, the techniques they used and other aspects of their work. The three books discussed are: ‘A pet for Mrs. Arbuckle’ by Gwenda Smyth, illustrated by Anne James, ‘Five times dizzy’ by Nadia Wheatley and ‘The Inside hedge story’ by Gillian Barnett.

results.title: Coventry Cathedral construction and consecration
results.brief_description: The building, embellishment and consecration of the new Cathedral Church of St. Michael at Coventry, from the preliminary earth moving in 1955 to completion seven years later, finishing with a tour of the completed cathedral, and the Consecration Ceremony attended by Her Majesty the Queen. Illuminates the contrasting skills which contributed to this achievement, and pays tribute to the architects, builders, engineers, artists and craftsmen who worked in stone and wood, glass, metal and tapestry.

results.title: Coventry cathedral
results.creator_credit: British Council, BFI and Dudley Shaw Ashton
results.brief_description: Coventry’s medieval cathedral was destroyed by air raids in 1940, but a new cathedral is being built from the design by Basil Spence. The architects model is shown and a realistic impression of the beautiful building is obtained. Spence gives an explanation of his work and he makes the point that all cathedrals were modern in their time. The work of artists and craftsmen specialising in stained glass, tapestry and stone are also shown. Commentary by Basil Spence.

results.title: Coventry and Ottobeuren join hands
results.creator_credit: F I B Dr W Lutje
results.brief_description: In 1964 the Benedictine monastery of Ottobeuren in Bavaria, celebrated its 12th centenary. Taking part in the celebrations was Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent, a manifestation of the cultural ties between Great Britain and Germany.
